Generation II.Gold: This Pok é mon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
Generation II.Silver: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
Generation II.Crystal: A mucous membrane covers its body. Touching it barehanded will cause a shooting pain.
Generation II.Stadium 2: This Pok é mon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
Generation III.Sapphire: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
Generation III.Emerald: Wooper usually live in water but come out onto land seeking food occasionally. On land, they coat their bodies with a gooey, toxic film.
Generation III.FireRed: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
Generation III.LeafGreen: This Pok é mon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

Generation IV.Diamond: It lives in cold water, half burying itself in mud at the bottom to sleep.
Generation IV.Pearl: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.
Generation IV.Platinum: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.
Generation IV.HeartGold: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.

Generation IX.Scarlet: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
Generation IX.Violet: It's dangerous for Wooper to travel alone. They line up in groups of three or four and help each other as they walk around the wetlands.
